capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was reading about Snape's family history and it turns out he has a pretty complicated lineage. Apparently, his parents were both wizards, but they weren't exactly... pure-blood. His mother was a Muggle, which is kind of surprising given how much emphasis is placed on bloodline in the wizarding world. Anyway, I think it's interesting that Snape's mixed heritage might have had an impact on his life and relationships.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was reading about Harry's family history and it turns out he has a pretty interesting mix of magical heritage. His parents were wizards, but his mom also had some Muggle roots, which makes him a half-blood wizard. That's what makes him so unique, you know? The fact that he's got both the best of both worlds - the magic of his father and the practicality of his mother's side.

It's incredible that he was able to overcome all those obstacles and become one of the most iconic heroes in the series.
